cheatsheet.title: Create a numerical column correlation analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis analyzes works with only nominal values and shows the relations between pairs of data in network graph. It highlights weak relationships between pairs of data in order to find potential incorrect relationships.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: This step opens the Create New Analysis wizard. You can right click on the "Analysis" folder (or click the link below). This wizard helps you to fill the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). At the end it opens the corresponding editor in which you can define the settings of the analysis.

item.title: Select the columns to analysis
item.description: Click the "Analyzed Columns" hyperlink (or click the link below). Then click "Select columns to analyze" to open a dialog box where you can select the nominal and interval columns to analyze.

item.title: Select the right data mining type
Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click on the "Run" button at the bottom of the editor (or click the link below). You can run the analysis with a context menu on the "Analysis" object in the "DQ Repository" view.

item.title: Refresh the graphics
item.description: To generate the graphics of the analysis, click on the "Refresh the graphics" hyperlink (or click the link below). "Refresh the graphics" means that graphics are displayed with the last computed data.
